content:
TITLE: Triggering CircleCI Pipeline by Project
DESCRIPTION: API request to trigger a new pipeline for a specific project. Requires a personal API token and supports parameters for revision, branch, or tag specification.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/source/includes/_builds_and_jobs.md#2025-04-19_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
curl -X POST https://circleci.com/api/v1.1/project/:vcs-type/:username/:project/build -H "Circle-Token: <circle-token>"
```

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "status": 200,
  "body": "Build created"
  }
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Retrieving Single Job Details with CircleCI API (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: This API endpoint retrieves the full details for a single CircleCI job. It requires the VCS type, username, project name, and build number as parameters. Authentication is done via a Circle-Token header.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/source/includes/_builds_and_jobs.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
curl https://circleci.com/api/v1.1/project/:vcs-type/:username/:project/:build_num -H "Circle-Token: <circle-token>"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Environment Variables with CircleCI API
DESCRIPTION: Makes a POST request to create a new environment variable for a project. Requires the variable name and value in the request body as JSON.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/source/includes/_environment_vars.md#2025-04-19_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
curl -X POST --header "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"name":"foo", "value":"bar"}' https://circleci.com/api/v1.1/project/:vcs-type/:username/:project/envvar -H "Circle-Token: <circle-token>"
```

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{"name":"foo","value":"xxxx"}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Retrieving Artifacts of a Job with CircleCI API using curl
DESCRIPTION: API request to fetch all artifacts produced by a specific build job. Returns an array of artifact objects containing path, pretty_path, node_index, and URL for each artifact. Requires a CircleCI API token for authentication.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/source/includes/_artifacts.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
curl https://circleci.com/api/v1.1/project/:vcs-type/:username/:project/:build_num/artifacts -H "Circle-Token: <circle-token>"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Triggering a New CircleCI Job (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: This API endpoint triggers a new CircleCI job. It requires the VCS type, username, and project name as parameters. Additional parameters like job name, tag, parallel execution, and build parameters can be specified in the request body. Authentication is done via a Circle-Token header.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/source/includes/_builds_and_jobs.md#2025-04-19_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
curl -X POST --header "Content-Type: application/json" -H "Circle-Token: <circle-token>" -d '{
  "job": "deploy-preview"
  "tag": "v0.1", // optional
  "parallel": 2, //optional, default null
  "build_parameters": { // optional
    "RUN_EXTRA_TESTS": "true"
  }
}'

https://circleci.com/api/v1.1/project/:vcs-type/:username/:project
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Authenticating with CircleCI API using Token (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to make an authenticated API request to CircleCI using a token in the Circle-Token header. This example retrieves user information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/source/includes/_overview.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
$ curl -H "Circle-Token: <circle-token>" https://circleci.com/api/v1.1/me
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Triggering CircleCI Pipeline Run via API (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: This curl command initiates a pipeline run in CircleCI. It requires the CircleCI API token, organization ID, project ID, and pipeline definition ID. The command specifies the branch to use and sets a custom parameter for running Storybook tests.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/jekyll/_includes/snippets/logic-statement-examples/expression-based-job-filters/api-trigger.txt#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl -X POST https://circleci.com/api/v2/project/circleci/<org-id>/<project-id>/pipeline/run \
  --header "Circle-Token: $CIRCLE_TOKEN" \
  --header "content-type: application/json" \
  --data {
  "definition_id": "<pipeline-definition-id>",
  "config": {"branch": "<your-branch-name>"},
  "checkout": {"branch": "<your-branch-name>"},
  "parameters": {"run-storybook-tests": "true"}
  }
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Retrieving CircleCI Test Metadata
DESCRIPTION: API request to fetch test metadata for a specific job, including test results, run times, and file locations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/source/includes/_builds_and_jobs.md#2025-04-19_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
curl https://circleci.com/api/v1.1/project/:vcs-type/:username/:project/:build_num/tests -H "Circle-Token: <circle-token>"
```

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "tests" : [ {
    "message" : "",
    "file" : "features/desktop/invitations.feature",
    "source" : "cucumber",
    "run_time" : 2.957513661,
    "result" : "success",
    "name" : "Accepting an invitation",
    "classname" : "Invitations"
  }, {
    "message" : null,
    "file" : "spec/lib/webfinger_spec.rb",
    "source" : "rspec",
    "run_time" : 0.011366,
    "result" : "success",
    "name" : "Webfinger#intialize sets account ",
    "classname" : "spec.lib.webfinger_spec"
  } ]
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Create SSH Key - CircleCI API
DESCRIPTION: POST request to create an SSH key for external system authentication. Requires hostname and private key parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/source/includes/_keys.md#2025-04-19_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
curl -X POST --header "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"hostname":"hostname","private_key":"RSA private key"}' https://circleci.com/api/v1.1/project/:vcs-type/:username/:project/ssh-key -H "Circle-Token: <circle-token>"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Environment Variables with CircleCI API (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: This command creates a new environment variable for a CircleCI project. It requires the variable name and value in the request body as JSON.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/source/includes/environment_variables.md#2025-04-19_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
curl -H "Circle-Token: <circle-token>" -X POST --header "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"name":"foo", "value":"bar"}' https://circleci.com/api/v1.1/project/:vcs-type/:username/:project/envvar
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Retrieving Artifacts from Latest Job Run with CircleCI API
DESCRIPTION: API request to fetch artifacts from the latest job run on a specific branch. Supports optional branch and filter parameters to narrow down results. The filter parameter can be set to 'completed', 'successful', 'failed', or 'running'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/source/includes/_artifacts.md#2025-04-19_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
curl https://circleci.com/api/v1.1/project/:vcs-type/:username/:project/latest/artifacts?branch=:branch&filter=:filter -H "Circle-Token: <circle-token>"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Deleting Environment Variables with CircleCI API (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: This command deletes a specific environment variable by name from a CircleCI project. It uses the DELETE HTTP method to remove the specified variable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/source/includes/environment_variables.md#2025-04-19_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
curl -H "Circle-Token: <circle-token>" -X DELETE https://circleci.com/api/v1.1/project/:vcs-type/:username/:project/envvar/:name
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Retrieving All Followed Projects with CircleCI API
DESCRIPTION: This GET request retrieves an array of all projects the user is following on CircleCI, including detailed job information organized by branch.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/source/includes/_projects.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
curl https://circleci.com/api/v1.1/projects -H "Circle-Token: <circle-token>"
```

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
[ {
  "vcs_url": "https://github.com/circleci/mongofinil",
  "followed": true, // true if you follow this project in CircleCI
  "username": "circleci",
  "reponame": "mongofinil",
  "branches" : {
    "master" : {
      "pusher_logins" : [ "pbiggar", "arohner" ], // users who have pushed
      "last_non_success" : { // last failed job on this branch
        "pushed_at" : "2013-02-12T21:33:14Z",
        "vcs_revision" : "1d231626ba1d2838e599c5c598d28e2306ad4e48",
        "build_num" : 22,
        "outcome" : "failed",
        },
      "last_success" : { // last successful job on this branch
        "pushed_at" : "2012-08-09T03:59:53Z",
        "vcs_revision" : "384211bbe72b2a22997116a78788117b3922d570",
        "build_num" : 15,
        "outcome" : "success",
        },
      "recent_builds" : [ { // last 5 jobs, ordered by pushed_at (decreasing)
        "pushed_at" : "2013-02-12T21:33:14Z",
        "vcs_revision" : "1d231626ba1d2838e599c5c598d28e2306ad4e48",
        "build_num" : 22,
        "outcome" : "failed",
        }, {
        "pushed_at" : "2013-02-11T03:09:54Z",
        "vcs_revision" : "0553ba86b35a97e22ead78b0d568f6a7c79b838d",
        "build_num" : 21,
        "outcome" : "failed",
        }, ... ],
      "running_builds" : [ ] // currently running jobs
    }
  }
}, ... ]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Downloading Individual Artifact File from CircleCI
DESCRIPTION: API request to download a specific artifact file from CircleCI. Uses curl with redirect following (-L flag) since artifact URLs may redirect. Requires a CircleCI API token with 'view-builds' scope for authentication.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/source/includes/_artifacts.md#2025-04-19_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
curl -L https://132-55688803-gh.circle-artifacts.com/0//tmp/circle-artifacts.7wgAaIU/file.txt -H "Circle-Token: <circle-token>"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Retrying a CircleCI Job (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: This API endpoint retries a specific CircleCI job. It requires the VCS type, organization name, project name, and build number as parameters. Authentication is done via a Circle-Token header. The response includes a summary of the new job run.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/source/includes/_builds_and_jobs.md#2025-04-19_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
curl -X POST https://circleci.com/api/v1.1/project/:vcs-type/:org_name/:project/:build_num/retry -H "Circle-Token: <circle-token>"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Authenticating with CircleCI API using Different Methods (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Shows three different ways to authenticate with the CircleCI API: using a token in the header, using HTTP Basic Authentication, and using a query parameter (deprecated).
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/source/includes/_overview.md#2025-04-19_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
curl -H "Circle-Token: <circle-token>" "https://circleci.com/api/..."
```

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
curl -u <circle-token>: "https://circleci.com/api/..."
```

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
curl "https://circleci.com/api/v1.1/me?circle-token=<circle-token>"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Deleting Environment Variables with CircleCI API
DESCRIPTION: Makes a DELETE request to remove a specific environment variable by name from a project. Returns a confirmation message on success.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/source/includes/_environment_vars.md#2025-04-19_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
curl -X DELETE https://circleci.com/api/v1.1/project/:vcs-type/:username/:project/envvar/:name -H "Circle-Token: <circle-token>"
```

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{"message":"ok"}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Single Job Details Response from CircleCI API (JSON)
DESCRIPTION: This JSON response contains detailed information about a CircleCI job, including VCS details, build information, commit details, and step-by-step actions performed during the job execution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/source/includes/_builds_and_jobs.md#2025-04-19_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "vcs_url" : "https://github.com/circleci/mongofinil",
  "build_url" : "https://circleci.com/gh/circleci/mongofinil/22",
  "build_num" : 22,
  "branch" : "master",
  "vcs_revision" : "1d231626ba1d2838e599c5c598d28e2306ad4e48",
  "committer_name" : "Allen Rohner",
  "committer_email" : "arohner@gmail.com",
  "subject" : "Don't explode when the system clock shifts backwards",
  "body" : "", // commit message body
  "why" : "github", // short string explaining the reason the job ran
  "dont_build" : null, // reason why we didn't build, if we didn't build
  "queued_at" : "2013-02-12T21:33:30Z", // time the job was queued
  "start_time" : "2013-02-12T21:33:38Z", // time the job started
  "stop_time" : "2013-02-12T21:34:01Z", // time the job finished
  "build_time_millis" : 23505,
  "username" : "circleci",
  "reponame" : "mongofinil",
  "lifecycle" : "finished", // :queued, :not_run, :not_running, :running or :finished
  "outcome" : "success", // :canceled, :infrastructure_fail, :timedout, :failed, :no_tests or :success
  "status" : "success", // :retried, :canceled, :infrastructure_fail, :timedout, :not_run, :running, :failed, :queued, :not_running, :no_tests, :fixed, :success
  "retry_of" : null, // build_num of the job that this is a retry of
  "steps" : [ {
    "name" : "configure the build",
    "actions" : [ {
      "bash_command" : null,
      "run_time_millis" : 1646,
      "start_time" : "2013-02-12T21:33:38Z",
      "end_time" : "2013-02-12T21:33:39Z",
      "name" : "configure the build",
      "exit_code" : null,
      "type" : "infrastructure",
      "index" : 0,
      "status" : "success",
    } ] },

    "name" : "lein2 deps",
    "actions" : [ {
      "bash_command" : "lein2 deps",
      "run_time_millis" : 7555,
      "start_time" : "2013-02-12T21:33:47Z",
      "messages" : [ ],
      "step" : 1,
      "exit_code" : 0,
      "end_time" : "2013-02-12T21:33:54Z",
      "index" : 0,
      "status" : "success",
      "type" : "dependencies",
      "source" : "inference",
      "failed" : null
    } ] },
    "name" : "lein2 trampoline midje",
    "actions" : [ {
      "bash_command" : "lein2 trampoline midje",
      "run_time_millis" : 2310,
      "continue" : null,
      "parallel" : true,
      "start_time" : "2013-02-12T21:33:59Z",
      "name" : "lein2 trampoline midje",
      "messages" : [ ],
      "step" : 6,
      "exit_code" : 1,
      "end_time" : "2013-02-12T21:34:01Z",
      "index" : 0,
      "status" : "failed",
      "timedout" : null,
      "infrastructure_fail" : null,
      "type" : "test",
      "source" : "inference",
      "failed" : true
    } ]
  } ],
  ...
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Create New Checkout Key - CircleCI API
DESCRIPTION: POST request to create a new checkout key. Requires user API token and accepts key type parameter.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/source/includes/_keys.md#2025-04-19_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
curl -X POST --header "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"type":"github-user-key"}' https://circleci.com/api/v1.1/project/:vcs-type/:username/:project/checkout-key -H "Circle-Token: <circle-token>"
```

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{"public_key": "ssh-rsa...",
  "type": "deploy-key", // can be "deploy-key" or "user-key"
  "fingerprint": "c9:0b:1c:4f:d5:65:56:b9:ad:88:f9:81:2b:37:74:2f",
  "preferred": true,
  "time" : "2015-09-21T17:29:21.042Z" // when the key was issued
  }
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cancel Job Response from CircleCI API (JSON)
DESCRIPTION: This JSON response contains a summary of the canceled CircleCI job. It includes details such as VCS information, build status, and cancellation-specific fields.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/source/includes/_builds_and_jobs.md#2025-04-19_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "vcs_url" : "https://github.com/circleci/mongofinil",
  "build_url" : "https://circleci.com/gh/circleci/mongofinil/26",
  "build_num" : 26,
  "branch" : "master",
  "vcs_revision" : "59c9c5ea3e289f2f3b0c94e128267cc0ce2d65c6",
  "committer_name" : "Allen Rohner",
  "committer_email" : "arohner@gmail.com",
  "subject" : "Merge pull request #6 from dlowe/master"
  "body" : "le bump", // commit message body
  "why" : "retry", // short string explaining the reason we built
  "dont_build" : null, // reason why we didn't build, if we didn't build
  "queued_at" : "2013-05-24T19:37:59.095Z" // time the job was queued
  "start_time" : null, // time the job started running
  "stop_time" : null, // time the job finished running
  "build_time_millis" : null,
  "username" : "circleci",
  "reponame" : "mongofinil",
  "lifecycle" : "queued",
  "outcome" : "canceled",
  "status" : "canceled",
  "canceled" : true,
  "retry_of" : 25, // build_num of the job that this is a retry of
  "previous" : { // previous job
    "status" : "success",
    "build_num" : 25
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Canceling a CircleCI Job (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: This API endpoint cancels a specific CircleCI job. It requires the VCS type, username, project name, and build number as parameters. Authentication is done via a Circle-Token header. The response includes a summary of the canceled job.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/source/includes/_builds_and_jobs.md#2025-04-19_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
curl -X POST https://circleci.com/api/v1.1/project/:vcs-type/:username/:project/:build_num/cancel -H "Circle-Token: <circle-token>"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Displaying CircleCI Build Status Badge in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to embed a CircleCI build status badge in a Markdown file. It uses the CircleCI API to dynamically display the current build status of the circleci-docs repository.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Markdown
CODE:
```
[![CircleCI Build Status](https://circleci.com/gh/circleci/circleci-docs.svg?style=shield)](https://circleci.com/gh/circleci/circleci-docs)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Environment Variables with CircleCI API (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: This command retrieves a list of all environment variables for a CircleCI project. It returns the variable names along with partially masked values (four 'x' characters plus the last four ASCII characters of the actual value).
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/source/includes/environment_variables.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
curl -H "Circle-Token: <circle-token>" https://circleci.com/api/v1.1/project/:vcs-type/:username/:project/envvar
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Environment Variables List Response Format (JSON)
DESCRIPTION: The JSON response format when listing environment variables. Values are partially masked for security, showing only the last four characters preceded by 'x' characters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/source/includes/environment_variables.md#2025-04-19_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
[{
	"name": "foo",
	"value": "xxxx1234"
}]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Environment Variables with CircleCI API
DESCRIPTION: Makes a GET request to list all environment variables for a project. The returned values are partially masked for security, showing only the last four characters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/source/includes/_environment_vars.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
curl https://circleci.com/api/v1.1/project/:vcs-type/:username/:project/envvar -H "Circle-Token: <circle-token>"
```

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
[{"name":"foo","value":"xxxx1234"}]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Example JSON Response for Latest Job Artifacts API
DESCRIPTION: Sample JSON response when fetching artifacts from the latest job. Returns the same format as the standard artifacts endpoint, with each artifact containing path, pretty_path, node_index, and URL properties.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/source/includes/_artifacts.md#2025-04-19_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
[ {
  "path" : "raw-test-output/go-test-report.xml",
  "pretty_path" : "raw-test-output/go-test-report.xml",
  "node_index" : 0,
  "url" : "https://24-88881093-gh.circle-artifacts.com/0/raw-test-output/go-test-report.xml"
}, {
  "path" : "raw-test-output/go-test.out",
  "pretty_path" : "raw-test-output/go-test.out",
  "node_index" : 0,
  "url" : "https://24-88881093-gh.circle-artifacts.com/0/raw-test-output/go-test.out"
} ]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Delete Checkout Key - CircleCI API
DESCRIPTION: DELETE request to remove a checkout key by fingerprint. Supports both md5 and sha256 fingerprint types.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/source/includes/_keys.md#2025-04-19_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
curl -X DELETE https://circleci.com/api/v1.1/project/:vcs-type/:username/:project/checkout-key/:fingerprint -H "Circle-Token: <circle-token>"
```

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{"message":"ok"}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Add Heroku API Key - CircleCI API
DESCRIPTION: POST request to add a Heroku API key to CircleCI. Takes apikey as a form parameter.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/source/includes/_keys.md#2025-04-19_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
curl -X POST --header "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"apikey":"Heroku key"}' https://circleci.com/user/heroku-key -H "Circle-Token: <circle-token>"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Retrieving a Single Environment Variable with CircleCI API (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: This command retrieves details for a specific environment variable by name. The response includes the variable name and a masked value.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/source/includes/environment_variables.md#2025-04-19_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
curl -H "Circle-Token: <circle-token>" https://circleci.com/api/v1.1/project/:vcs-type/:username/:project/envvar/:name
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building API v1 Documentation Locally with Bash
DESCRIPTION: This command runs a script to build the API v1 documentation locally. The rendered output can then be viewed in a web browser.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/README.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
./scripts/build_api_docs.sh -v1
```

TITLE: Following a New Project on CircleCI via API

TITLE: Retrieving a Single Environment Variable with CircleCI API
DESCRIPTION: Makes a GET request to retrieve a specific environment variable by name. The returned value is masked for security purposes.

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
curl https://circleci.com/api/v1.1/project/:vcs-type/:username/:project/envvar/:name -H "Circle-Token: <circle-token>"
```

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{"name":"foo","value":"xxxx"}
```

TITLE: Retrieving User Information with CircleCI API using curl
DESCRIPTION: This curl command makes a GET request to the CircleCI API to retrieve information about the currently signed in user. It requires a personal API token which must be provided in the Circle-Token header.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/source/includes/_user.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
curl https://circleci.com/api/v1.1/me -H "Circle-Token: <circle-token>"
```

TITLE: List Checkout Keys - CircleCI API
DESCRIPTION: GET request to retrieve an array of checkout keys for a project. Supports optional digest parameter for fingerprint type (md5 or sha256).
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/source/includes/_keys.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
curl https://circleci.com/api/v1.1/project/:vcs-type/:username/:project/checkout-key?digest=sha256 -H "Circle-Token: <circle-token>"
```

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
[{"public_key": "ssh-rsa...",
  "type": "deploy-key", // can be "deploy-key" or "github-user-key"
  "fingerprint": "AddwN379YO1pnTyrOqALUZmo6XU4zJ2RLuOZslrl7c4",
  "preferred": true,
  "time" : "2015-09-21T17:29:21.042Z" // when the key was issued
  }]
```

TITLE: Adding Document Attributes and Front Matter in Asciidoc
DESCRIPTION: Example of how to add required document attributes and front matter to a new Asciidoc article in the CircleCI documentation. This includes version information, layout settings, and page description.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/docs/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: asciidoc
CODE:
```
---
version:
- Server v4.x
- Admin
---
= Page title
:page-layout: classic-docs
:page-liquid:
:page-description: A short description of the content on the page.
```

TITLE: Creating Tabbed Elements in Markdown for CircleCI Documentation
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to implement tabbed content in Jekyll's Markdown for displaying alternate versions of content (like screenshots) for CircleCI Cloud and Server. The tabs use CSS classes to group related content.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/docs/WIDGETS.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
{:.tab.jobscreenshot.Cloud}
![Some alt text]({{ site.baseurl }}/assets/img/docs/new-job-page.png)

{:.tab.jobscreenshot.Server}
![Some alt text]({{ site.baseurl }}/assets/img/docs/old-job-page.png)
```

TITLE: Delete SSH Key - CircleCI API
DESCRIPTION: DELETE request to remove an SSH key using fingerprint and hostname. Supports both md5 and sha256 fingerprint types.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/source/includes/_keys.md#2025-04-19_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
curl -X DELETE --header "Content-Type: application/json" -d {"fingerprint":"Fingerprint", "hostname":"Hostname"} https://circleci.com/api/v1.1/project/:vcs-type/:username/:project/ssh-key -H "Circle-Token: <circle-token>"
```

TITLE: Fetching Recent Jobs Across All Projects with CircleCI API

CODE:
```
curl https://circleci.com/api/v1.1/recent-builds?limit=1&shallow=true
```

TITLE: Including Site Variables in Code Blocks for CircleCI Documentation
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use site variables within a code block in AsciiDoc format for CircleCI documentation. This technique allows for dynamic content in code examples, such as version numbers or image names.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/docs/Content-Reuse.md#2025-04-19_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: asciidoc
CODE:
```
[source,yaml,subs=attributes+]
----
version: 2.1
jobs:
  build:
    machine:
      image: {<my_variable_name>}
    resource_class: large
----
```

TITLE: Triggering CircleCI Job with Branch

  "build_parameters": { // optional

TITLE: Sample JSON Response from CircleCI API with Shallow Parameter
DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet shows a sample response from the CircleCI API when using the 'shallow' parameter. It includes key information about a recent build, such as build number, branch, commit details, and build status.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/source/includes/_projects.md#2025-04-19_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
[ {
  "vcs_url" : "https://github.com/circleci/mongofinil",
  "build_url" : "https://circleci.com/gh/circleci/mongofinil/22",
  "build_num" : 22,
  "branch" : "master",
  "vcs_revision" : "1d231626ba1d2838e599c5c598d28e2306ad4e48",
  "committer_name" : "Allen Rohner",
  "committer_email" : "arohner@gmail.com",
  "subject" : "Don't explode when the system clock shifts backwards",
  "body" : "", // commit message body
  "why" : "github", // short string explaining the reason we built
  "dont_build" : null, // reason why we didn't build, if we didn't build
  "queued_at" : "2013-02-12T21:33:30Z" // time the job was queued
  "start_time" : "2013-02-12T21:33:38Z", // time the job started running
  "stop_time" : "2013-02-12T21:34:01Z", // time the job finished running
  "build_time_millis" : 23505,
  "username" : "circleci",
  "reponame" : "mongofinil",
  "lifecycle" : "finished", // :queued, :not_run, :not_running, :running or :finished
  "outcome" : "failed", // :canceled, :infrastructure_fail, :timedout, :failed, :no_tests or :success
  "status" : "failed", // :retried, :canceled, :infrastructure_fail, :timedout, :not_run, :running, :failed, :queued, :not_running, :no_tests, :fixed, :success
  "retry_of" : null, // build_num of the job that this is a retry of
  "previous" : { // previous job
    "status" : "failed",
    "build_num" : 21
  }, ... ]
```

TITLE: Sample JSON Response from CircleCI User API
DESCRIPTION: This is an example of the JSON response returned by the CircleCI user API endpoint. It includes email preference settings and the user's GitHub username.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/source/includes/_user.md#2025-04-19_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "basic_email_prefs" : "smart", // can be "smart", "none" or "all"
  "login" : "pbiggar" // your github username
}
```

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "php-pear": "5.3.10-1ubuntu3.21",
    "php5-cli": "5.3.10-1ubuntu3.21",
    "php5-common": "5.3.10-1ubuntu3.21",
    [...remaining package entries...]
    "whois": "5.0.15ubuntu2",
    "wkhtmltopdf": "0.9.9-3"
}
```

TITLE: Sample Response from CircleCI API (JSON)
DESCRIPTION: Example JSON response from the CircleCI API when requesting user information. It includes details such as user key, trial status, and login.

```
{
  "user_key_fingerprint" : null,
  "days_left_in_trial" : -238,
  "trial_end" : "2011-12-28T22:02:15Z",
  "basic_email_prefs" : "smart",
  "admin" : true,
  "login" : "pbiggar"
 }
```

TITLE: Using OS Version Matrix Widget in CircleCI Documentation
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to implement the OS Version Matrix widget to display software version compatibility across different operating systems supported by CircleCI. Version information can be hardcoded or pulled from Jekyll data files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/docs/WIDGETS.md#2025-04-19_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: liquid
CODE:
```
{% include os-matrix.html trusty=site.data.trusty.versions.summary.docker precise="v1.7.1" macos="n/a" %}
```

TITLE: Including Snippets in CircleCI Documentation
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to include a snippet within a page using Liquid templating syntax. Snippets can be saved as .md, .adoc, or .html files and should be located in the jekyll/_includes/snippets directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/docs/Content-Reuse.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
{% include snippets/<my-snippet>.adoc %}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Site Variables in CircleCI Documentation
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to define site variables in the jekyll/_config.yml file using YAML syntax. These variables can be used throughout the documentation for consistent information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/docs/Content-Reuse.md#2025-04-19_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
my-variable-name: my-variable-value
```

TITLE: Creating Tabbed Elements in AsciiDoc for CircleCI Documentation
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to implement tabbed content in AsciiDoc for displaying alternate versions of content for CircleCI Cloud and Server. Each tab section is enclosed in double dashes and includes both text and image elements.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/docs/WIDGETS.md#2025-04-19_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: asciidoc
CODE:
```
[.tab.jobscreenshot.Cloud]
--
Description text paragraph blah blah

.Image titlex
image::new-job-page.png[Some alt text]
--

[.tab.jobscreenshot.Server]
--
Description text paragraph blah blah

.Image title
image::old-job-page.png[Some alt text]
--
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Site Variables in Markdown for CircleCI Documentation
DESCRIPTION: Illustrates the syntax for using site variables within a Markdown page in CircleCI documentation. This allows for dynamic content insertion.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/docs/Content-Reuse.md#2025-04-19_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
{{site.<my_variable_name>}}
```

TITLE: Ubuntu Package Version Manifest
DESCRIPTION: A JSON object containing Ubuntu package names as keys and their corresponding version numbers as values. Includes both standard and i386 architecture versions of packages.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/jekyll/assets/versions.txt#2025-04-19_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "libexpat1": "2.1.0-4ubuntu1.1",
    "libexpat1:i386": "2.1.0-4ubuntu1.1",
    "libexpat1-dev": "2.1.0-4ubuntu1.1",
    "libexporter-lite-perl": "0.02-2",
    "libexttextcat-data": "3.2.0-1ubuntu1",
    "libexttextcat0": "3.2.0-1ubuntu1"
    //... additional packages omitted for brevity
}
```

TITLE: Using Site Variables in AsciiDoc for CircleCI Documentation
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to include site variables in an AsciiDoc page for CircleCI documentation. This method is used for inline variable substitution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/docs/Content-Reuse.md#2025-04-19_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: asciidoc
CODE:
```
{<my_variable_name>}
```

TITLE: Using OS Version Matrix Widget with Single OS Support
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the OS Version Matrix widget when software is only compatible with a single operating system (Ubuntu 14.04 "Trusty" in this example).
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/docs/WIDGETS.md#2025-04-19_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: liquid
CODE:
```
{% include os-matrix.html trusty=site.data.trusty.versions.summary.docker %}
```

TITLE: Package Dependency List - Ubuntu System Libraries
DESCRIPTION: A structured list of Ubuntu package dependencies containing library names, version numbers and architecture information. This includes system libraries, development packages, and runtime dependencies used in an Ubuntu environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/jekyll/assets/versions.txt#2025-04-19_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
"libidl-common": "0.8.14-0.2ubuntu2",
"libidl0": "0.8.14-0.2ubuntu2",
"libidn11": "1.23-2",
"libidn11:i386": "1.23-2",
"libidn11-dev": "1.23-2",
[...remaining package list...]
```

TITLE: Documentation Configuration in YAML
DESCRIPTION: YAML frontmatter configuration block that defines the structure and settings for the CircleCI API documentation. Specifies the title, programming language tabs, included documentation sections, and search functionality.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/src-api/source/index.html.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
---
title: CircleCI API Reference

language_tabs:
  - shell
  
includes:
  - overview
  - user
  - projects
  - builds_and_jobs
  - keys
  - artifacts
  - environment_vars

search: true
---
```

TITLE: Displaying Japanese Translation Progress Badge in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to include a dynamic badge showing the progress of Japanese translation for the documentation. It uses a JSON query to fetch the translation progress from Crowdin.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-19_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: Markdown
CODE:
```
[![ja translation](https://img.shields.io/badge/dynamic/json?color=blue&label=ja&style=flat&query=%24.progress.0.data.translationProgress&url=https%3A%2F%2Fbadges.awesome-crowdin.com%2Fstats-13528254-306408.json)](https://crowdin.com)
```

TITLE: Displaying CircleCI Insights Snapshot Badge in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to embed a CircleCI Insights snapshot badge in a Markdown file. It displays build and deploy metrics for the master branch over the last 30 days.

LANGUAGE: Markdown
CODE:
```
[![CircleCI](https://dl.circleci.com/insights-snapshot/gh/circleci/circleci-docs/master/build-deploy/badge.svg?window=30d)](https://app.circleci.com/insights/github/circleci/circleci-docs/workflows/build-deploy/overview?branch=master&reporting-window=last-30-days&insights-snapshot=true)
```

TITLE: Case Sensitive Pattern Matching in Regex
DESCRIPTION: Regular expressions for matching various forms of brand names and common words with specific capitalization patterns. Includes patterns for CircleCI, Bitbucket, PostgreSQL and common English words.
SOURCE: https://github.com/circleci/circleci-docs/blob/master/styles/config/vocabularies/Docs/reject.txt#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: regex
CODE:
```
\bCircleci\b
```

LANGUAGE: regex
CODE:
```
\bcircleCI\b
```

LANGUAGE: regex
CODE:
```
\bcircleci\s
```

LANGUAGE: regex
CODE:
```
\bCircelCI\b
```

LANGUAGE: regex
CODE:
```
please
```

LANGUAGE: regex
CODE:
```
Please
```

LANGUAGE: regex
CODE:
```
bitbucket
```

LANGUAGE: regex
CODE:
```
BitBucket
```

LANGUAGE: regex
CODE:
```
PostgrSQL
```

LANGUAGE: regex
CODE:
